cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of Sparse Linear Regression, which is a well-studied problem in machine learning and statistics. The paper presents algorithms and conditional lower bounds for several variants of this problem, including the Affine SLR and Convex SLR. The problem has applications in sparse recovery, which falls under the category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper also deals with optimization problems, which is a common theme in Machine Learning (cs.LG). The problem involves working with sparse vectors, which is a topic in Data Structures (cs.DS). The paper also presents lower bounds, which is a topic in Computational Complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper presents algorithms for solving the problem, which involves numerical methods, which is a topic in Numerical Analysis (cs.NA).
